intro: Saccus champeden, commonly known as the African orchid. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble a small pouch or sac, hence its scientific name. The plant belongs to the Orchidaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. Its flowers are often brightly colored, with a range of hues including yellow, orange, and red. Saccus champeden is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal regions where it thrives in full sun.
